treatment.description: Plants: burl present; twigs (smooth), usually glabrous, sometimes puberulent. Leaves (spreading); petiole 6–10 mm; blade gray-glaucous, oblong-ovate to lanceolate-ovate, 2–4 cm wide, apex acute. 2n = 52.
treatment.habitat: Chaparral or along forest edges, often along ridge crests
treatment.discussion: Subspecies mewukka is found on the western slopes of the Sierra Nevada from Butte to Tulare counties.
